Events that occurred on 22 July

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1916 - Ralph "the Baby" Payton, one of the T.C.B.S., is killed in action.
1925 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 8.
1925 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to H.F.B. Brett-Smith.
1928 – Actor Orson Bean is born.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 166.
1969 - Actor James Arnold Taylor is born.
1991 - German translator Margaret Carroux dies.
2002 - Actor Alexander John dies.
2008 - The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar, "The Ring-forges of Eregion" is released in North America.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
The funeral procession of king Théoden travels toward Edoras

content.title: Other versions of the legendarium
content.content: In some editions of The Lord of the Rings, the escort left the City on 19 July.
